# Itron Announces Appointment of Vice President, Investor Relations

LIBERTY LAKE, Wash.—September 6, 2011—Itron, Inc. (NASDAQ: ITRI), a leading solutions provider to the utility industry, announced today that Barbara Doyle has joined Itron as vice president of Investor Relations. Barbara has more than ten years of investor relations experience in the technology industry. Prior to joining Itron, Barbara was vice president of Investor Relations at Lawson Software, Inc., a $750 million revenue global provider of enterprise software solutions which was recently acquired by the private equity firm Golden Gate Capital.

Barbara began her career at IBM Corporation where she held positions of increasing responsibility in budgeting and planning, business development and controllership before moving into the investor relations group in 2000. Barbara holds a Bachelors of Science degree in Finance from Pennsylvania State University and an MBA from Duke University.

"I am pleased that Barbara has joined Itron and will be leading our investor relations function," said Steve Helmbrecht, Itron senior vice president and CFO. "Barbara is an experienced IR professional with a strong financial background and understanding of technology and solutions companies."

## About Itron

Itron is a proven global leader in energy, water, smart city, IIoT and intelligent infrastructure services. For utilities, cities and society, we build innovative systems, create new efficiencies, connect communities, encourage conservation and increase resourcefulness. By safeguarding our invaluable natural resources today and tomorrow, we improve the quality of life for people around the world. Join us: [www.itron.com](/).

Itron® is a registered trademark of Itron, Inc. All third-party trademarks are property of their respective owners and any usage herein does not suggest or imply any relationship between Itron and the third party unless expressly stated.

## Privacy Preference Center

When you visit any website, it may store or retrieve information on your browser, mostly in the form of cookies. This information might be about you, your preferences or your device and is mostly used to make the site work as you expect it to. The information does not usually directly identify you, but it can give you a more personalized web experience. Because we respect your right to privacy, you can choose not to allow some types of cookies. Click on the different category headings to find out more and change our default settings. However, blocking some types of cookies may impact your experience of the site and the services we are able to offer. [More information](https://www.itron.com/na/legal/cookies)

###  Manage Consent Preferences

#### Strictly Necessary Cookies

Always Active

These cookies are necessary for the website to function and cannot be switched off in our systems. They are usually only set in response to actions made by you which amount to a request for services, such as setting your privacy preferences, logging in or filling in forms. You can set your browser to block or alert you about these cookies, but some parts of the site will not then work. These cookies do not store any personally identifiable information.

Cookies Details‎

#### Functional Cookies

Functional Cookies

These cookies enable the website to provide enhanced functionality and personalisation. They may be set by us or by third party providers whose services we have added to our pages. If you do not allow these cookies then some or all of these services may not function properly.

Cookies Details‎

#### Targeting Cookies

Targeting Cookies

These cookies may be set through our site by our advertising partners. They may be used by those companies to build a profile of your interests and show you relevant adverts on other sites. They do not store directly personal information, but are based on uniquely identifying your browser and internet device. If you do not allow these cookies, you will experience less targeted advertising.

Cookies Details‎

#### Performance Cookies

Performance Cookies

These cookies allow us to count visits and traffic sources so we can measure and improve the performance of our site. They help us to know which pages are the most and least popular and see how visitors move around the site. All information these cookies collect is aggregated and therefore anonymous. If you do not allow these cookies we will not know when you have visited our site, and will not be able to monitor its performance.

# 2024 Resourcefulness ReportExploring AI for Utilities

Artificial intelligence can increase productivity and make sense of massive amounts of data. But its appetite for power and water begs the question: Is AI a problem or a solution for utilities?

Download Report [ Download Research Opens in new window ](https://go.itron.com/Resourcefulness-Report-Research-2024)

Today, perhaps somewhere near you, a data center will consume as much energy and water as a small city. The demands on utilities are growing so much, and so rapidly, that it’s hard to imagine keeping up with them by relying on what we’ve always done in the past. Population growth, new construction, electrical vehicle (EV) charging points, and the ravenous appetite of data centers that power our digital lives are putting historic stresses on electricity, gas and water utilities. Our **2024 Resourcefulness Report** explores how utility executives view AI’s role in addressing these challenges.

[DOWNLOAD EXECUTIVE SUMMARY](https://go.itron.com/Resourcefulness-Report-Summary-2024)

## 2023 Report Highlights

See the key takeaways from our 2023 report, highlighting utility executive and regulatory commissioner perspectives on building out the future U.S. electric grid.

## 2023 RESOURCEFULNESS REPORT

## Powering the Energy Transition

A transition to cleaner energy delivery is well underway in the U.S. What does this transition mean to utilities, commissioners and consumers?

## 2023 Report

Widespread electrification is creating the need for more capacity, control and flexibility. In this report, we asked utilities and state commissioners: How can we create the best future for the U.S. electric grid?

## Privacy Preference Center

When you visit any website, it may store or retrieve information on your browser, mostly in the form of cookies. This information might be about you, your preferences or your device and is mostly used to make the site work as you expect it to. The information does not usually directly identify you, but it can give you a more personalized web experience. Because we respect your right to privacy, you can choose not to allow some types of cookies. Click on the different category headings to find out more and change our default settings. However, blocking some types of cookies may impact your experience of the site and the services we are able to offer. [More information](https://www.itron.com/na/legal/cookies)

###  Manage Consent Preferences

#### Strictly Necessary Cookies

Always Active

These cookies are necessary for the website to function and cannot be switched off in our systems. They are usually only set in response to actions made by you which amount to a request for services, such as setting your privacy preferences, logging in or filling in forms. You can set your browser to block or alert you about these cookies, but some parts of the site will not then work. These cookies do not store any personally identifiable information.

Cookies Details‎

#### Functional Cookies

Functional Cookies

These cookies enable the website to provide enhanced functionality and personalisation. They may be set by us or by third party providers whose services we have added to our pages. If you do not allow these cookies then some or all of these services may not function properly.

Cookies Details‎

#### Targeting Cookies

Targeting Cookies

These cookies may be set through our site by our advertising partners. They may be used by those companies to build a profile of your interests and show you relevant adverts on other sites. They do not store directly personal information, but are based on uniquely identifying your browser and internet device. If you do not allow these cookies, you will experience less targeted advertising.

Cookies Details‎

#### Performance Cookies

Performance Cookies

These cookies allow us to count visits and traffic sources so we can measure and improve the performance of our site. They help us to know which pages are the most and least popular and see how visitors move around the site. All information these cookies collect is aggregated and therefore anonymous. If you do not allow these cookies we will not know when you have visited our site, and will not be able to monitor its performance.

# ENERGY FORECASTINGEducation and Networking

Itron is always at the forefront of the energy forecasting field. We help customers around the world understand the complexities of energy forecasting by talking about the latest forecasting issues and solutions.

Take advantage of Itron’s expertise and experience to gain insightful knowledge and let us help you to improve your forecasts. For more than 30 years, Itron has trained hundreds of energy forecasters. Select from hand-on workshops, live webinars, attend an annual meeting to network with your peers or keep current by [following our blog](/blog/forecasting).

  * ![](https://na.itron.com/documents/120737/398737/users-meeting.svg/2902ae74-a4ab-8ffa-d344-19f7fc06f672?t=1707268184222)

## **Workshops**

Lectures on real-world examples, demonstration of modeling techniques and hands-on exercises.

  * ![](https://na.itron.com/documents/120737/398737/pc-play-media.svg/fe2da082-06a2-eb22-b072-0dda4f4abb1b?t=1707267984445)

## **Brown Bag Webinars**

Free hour-long internet seminars on a range of forecasting topics

  * ![](https://na.itron.com/documents/120737/398737/presentation.svg/a5eb9f01-247a-3f33-6a1f-c407059be303?t=1707268113545)

## **Meetings**

Itron hosts several forecasting devoted meetings. Select the one best for you




[Forecasting products and services](/what-we-offer/energy-forecasting)

## Forecasting Workshops

Rely on Itron's forecasting training to provide your organization with increased knowledge, skills and confidence. We also provide on-site training and we can customize courses to meet the specific needs of your group.

## Forecasting and Load Research YouTube Library

Itron’s Forecasting group has conducted webinars on a variety of forecasting and load research-based topics for many years and continues to host new webinars every quarter. Past webinars were recorded and are available in a YouTube library. 

  * Access YouTube Library 



![](https://na.itron.com/documents/120737/141622/ImageBackground-blue1.png/910990ad-2ecc-293d-6a26-63f6633bb77a?t=1697820419277)

## Forecasting Workshops

Rely on Itron's forecasting training to provide your organization with increased knowledge, skills and confidence. We also provide on-site training and we can customize courses to meet the specific needs of your group.

## Forecasting Meetings

Itron wants to share its knowledge and foster the sharing of ideas and solutions in the energy forecasting community. Itron coordinates several important meetings each year so that forecasters can come together and benefit from networking and sharing ideas. Consider attending one of the annual meetings listed below.

  * [ ![](https://na.itron.com/documents/120737/141650/iStock-628947534.jpg/f1a3e5df-11a2-60b5-341a-e56b8301b1a1?t=1714424239695) April 9, 2025 Annual Energy Forecasting Meeting Savannah, GA ](/w/annual-energy-forecasting-meeting-2025)




  * ![](https://na.itron.com/documents/120737/2290396/iStock-1486721631.jpg/3aa65433-0e91-593c-1256-de97a56efaca?t=1707411379979)

## Forecasting 101 Workshop

This two- and half-day, hands-on workshop introduces the use of regression for forecasting applications. Designed for analysts and managers who are new to the forecasting area and do not have a background in statistical analysis. Participants will build sales and load forecasting models using linear regression and exponential smoothing models. 2024 dates and locations TBD

  * ![](https://na.itron.com/documents/120737/2290396/iStock-1486721631.jpg/3aa65433-0e91-593c-1256-de97a56efaca?t=1707411379979)

## Fundamentals of Sales and Demand Forecasting Workshop

This two- and half-day, hands-on workshop expands on the use of linear regression models in developing sales, energy, and demand forecasts to support the financial and long-term planning processes. Participants will build weather-normalized sales models, develop customer class sales forecast models and estimate peak demand forecasts and address new emerging technologies. 2024 dates and locations TBD

## Privacy Preference Center

When you visit any website, it may store or retrieve information on your browser, mostly in the form of cookies. This information might be about you, your preferences or your device and is mostly used to make the site work as you expect it to. Always Active

These cookies are necessary for the website to function and cannot be switched off in our systems. They are usually only set in response to actions made by you which amount to a request for services, such as setting your privacy preferences, logging in or filling in forms. These cookies may be set through our site by our advertising partners. They may be used by those companies to build a profile of your interests and show you relevant adverts on other sites. If you do not allow these cookies, you will experience less targeted advertising.

Performance Cookies

These cookies allow us to count visits and traffic sources so we can measure and improve the performance of our site.   * ![](https://na.itron.com/documents/120737/398737/presentation+%281%29.svg/b4c8e5c0-1ebd-e526-951b-aaa7e8c0fa16?t=1710890331526)

  * ![](https://na.itron.com/documents/120737/398737/communication.svg/eb9521bc-bbb4-9c51-4f69-0189d82a93eb?t=1706294407955)

  * ![](https://na.itron.com/documents/120737/398737/toast.svg/fb778b18-cbb2-cfa3-a8c4-5ecb0be54ab7?t=1710890429649)

## 4 networking events with 1 unforgettable party




  * [ Itron Inspire ](https://na.itron.com/itron-inspire)
  * [ Sponsors ](https://na.itron.com/itron-inspire/sponsors)
  * [ Advisory Board ](https://na.itron.com/itron-inspire/advisory-board)
  * [ Inspire Blog Posts ](https://na.itron.com/blog?filter_category_3571417=140374)



![](/documents/d/asset-library-120736/itron-inspire24-new-logo_full-color_blue-burst-png)

With a variety of keynotes, thought leadership, breakout sessions and networking events, Itron Inspire is the place to learn about the latest innovations in the energy and water space. We’ll show you how more intelligence leads to more possibilities and opens the door to a better connected, sustainable and more resourceful future.

## Itron Inspire Call for papers

Itron is now accepting abstract submissions for our premier, customer-focused event for smart cities and electricity, gas, and water providers—Itron Inspire.

Do you have a compelling story about a recent deployment? Valuable insights about how to best manage energy and water? Lessons learned from years in the utility industry? In the spirit of collaboration, we are looking for presentations that will help others learn from your experiences.

  * [ Submit abstract Opens in new window ](/itron-inspire/abstract-submission)



![](https://na.itron.com/documents/120737/141622/ImageBackground-red.png/67123575-b89d-e97c-0290-a64233548d92?t=1697640820805)

![](https://na.itron.com/documents/120737/2630962/GettyImages-1176650872.jpg/82c680db-6c18-f8c6-0277-17c9901a7f39?t=1729534231305)

## 2024 Event Recap

  * ![](//img.youtube.com/vi/-N4aygcQu9I/maxresdefault.jpg)

## The Power of Data

Tom Deitrich, Itron’s President and CEO, shares how data is key to unlocking more possibilities than ever before to optimize utility operations, consumer engagement and safety across the distribution system in this 2024 Itron Inspire keynote.

Watch Keynote

  * ![](//img.youtube.com/vi/U_ybMvtTz1I/maxresdefault.jpg)

## The Age of AI for Utilities is Here

In this 2024 Itron Inspire keynote, Marina Donovan—Vice President of Global Marketing, ESG and Public Affairs—discusses the findings of our latest edition of the Itron Resourcefulness Report, uncovering the role of artificial intelligence in the utility industry.

Watch Keynote

  * ![](//img.youtube.com/vi/0hPTRfogS2g/maxresdefault.jpg)

## The Ever Evolving Grid: Technology as a Business Enabler

Todd Inlander, Senior Vice President and Chief Information Officer at Southern California Edison, takes the Itron Inspire 2024 stage to share SCE’s technology vision and how it’s enabling new use cases—and new benefits—across their operations.

Watch Keynote




## Award Winners

  * ![](https://na.itron.com/documents/120737/3754354/Award-2024-Hydro+One.jpg/87b9724b-e4e6-6f53-d8cb-3ba134465fff?t=1730379487106)

## Itron Innovator Award

This award recognizes a utility or city customer that has leveraged Itron's partner enablement programs to deploy a breakthrough solution that solves challenges in energy and water efficiencies and smart communities. We are proud to announce **Hydro One** as the recipient of the 2024 Itron Innovator Award.

[ Read More ](/w/hydro-one-wins-2024-itron-innovator-award)

  * ![](https://na.itron.com/documents/120737/3754354/Award-2024-Greenville+Water+and+Alectra+Utilities.jpg/0e694e47-5dc5-cbb8-654a-a992e0467a04?t=1730379486696)

## Excellence in Resourcefulness Awards

This award recognizes utilities and cities that are achieving measurable outcomes and careful use of energy and water. Frost & Sullivan, in collaboration with Itron, is pleased to announce **Greenville Water** and **Alectra Utilities** as recipients of the ninth annual Excellence in Resourcefulness Awards.

[ Read More ](https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/frost--sullivan-honors-greenville-water-and-alectra-utilities-with-itron-excellence-in-resourcefulness-awards-302268849.html)

  * ![](https://na.itron.com/documents/120737/3754354/Itron+Inspire+Recap_2.jpeg/c8ab528a-e153-cd9c-af36-a51926ae7bf7?t=1715620208856)

## General Sessions

Join us on Monday and Tuesday morning for inspiring keynotes from industry leaders.

  * ![](https://na.itron.com/documents/120737/3754354/Itron+Inspire+Recap_3.jpeg/03f211ad-0a13-4c03-7a01-1e650b00a516?t=1715620174463)

## Big Picture Sessions

Hear from experts about the challenges shaping our industry-and how we can address them together.

  * ![](https://na.itron.com/documents/120737/3754354/Women+in+Utilities+Session+Blog.jpeg/81d9af34-4cfe-1f49-eb77-107532f19e54?t=1715620232627)

Celebrate the women helping drive our industry forward. Featuring a panel or keynote speaker, this is open to all attendees.

## Itron Inspire at a Glance

The Knowledge Conference—our main event at Itron Inspire—takes place Oct. 6-8, with pre- and post-conference training and customer forums happening before and after the Knowledge Conference. Click a title below to learn more.

X

![](https://na.itron.com/documents/120737/3754354/iStock-172391876.jpg/da063a85-dcb6-fddd-32e9-fc37d34c3ecb?t=1714677367716)

## **Itron Inspire** at a glance

The Knowledge Conference—our main event at Itron Inspire—takes place Oct. 6-8, with pre- and post-conference training and customer forums happening before and after the Knowledge Conference.

**Oct. 4-6** | Pre-Conference Training & IEE MDM Users' Forum

**Oct. 6-8** | Knowledge Conference (keynotes, breakout sessions, exhibition center, networking events)

**Oct. 9-10** | Customer Forums & Users' Groups (additional fees may apply)

## Tracks, Breakouts and More

At Itron Inspire, content is king. And we have plenty of it, all geared toward helping you explore what’s possible with more intelligence throughout your delivery system. In addition to networking events and our general sessions on Monday and Tuesday, we have a host of breakout sessions spread across four tracks.

Not sure where to begin? Explore some of Itron’s latest solutions in one of these key areas with a short-list of relevant sessions to attend and booths to visit in the Knowledge Center:

**[Grid Edge Intelligence](/itron-inspire/sessions?filter_category_7076337=6740847#filters)** | **[Gas Edge](/itron-inspire/sessions?filter_category_7076337=6740721#filters)** | **[Smart Cities](/itron-inspire/sessions?filter_category_7076337=6899102#filters)** | **[Smart Water Solutions](/itron-inspire/sessions?filter_category_7076337=6740727#filters)**

### Choose Your Track

Welcome Reception

## Welcome Reception

## Palm Desert Pool Party

Our annual themed party is poolside this year—and will be held on Tuesday evening instead of Monday.**Oct. 8**

## The Knowledge Center

Explore the latest technology and services to help you better manage energy and water delivery. The Knowledge Center is our interactive solution showroom where you can get a demo, talk to experts, connect with peers and take in our latest Itron Experience presentation.

![](https://na.itron.com/documents/120737/2630962/ImageBackground-blue2.png/c9cad844-88e2-2161-6909-3ef687da0447?t=1708457987225)

![](https://na.itron.com/documents/120737/3754354/IMG_0283.jpg/8e544395-a3f5-d440-b321-90e849f26374?t=1715342063323)

## ABOUT THE VENUE JW Marriott Desert Springs Resort & Spa

Experience the beauty of the desert at JW Marriott Desert Springs Resort & Spa. This refreshed, luxury hotel features superb service, redesigned venues, onsite recreation activities like biking, golf and tennis, and truly magnificent views— all just minutes from downtown Palm Springs, Indian Wells, the Coachella Valley and Joshua Tree National Park.

![](https://na.itron.com/documents/44647/138707/GreenBackground.png/13376b61-d79c-d0e8-177d-161b653ea39d?t=1704392217992)

![](https://na.itron.com/documents/120737/3754354/View+of+lake+and+Boat+from+Balcony.jpg/6fa5a608-5daf-6898-70e5-115a105ec885?t=1715361914458)
